Authors: Subakti A.G., Anita T.L., Triana I.
Title: The impact of consumer perceptions to technology-based facilities at bobobox capsule hotel, jakarta
Source title: Proceedings of 2020 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2020
Affiliations: Bina Nusantara University, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Hotel Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Subakti, A.G., Bina Nusantara University, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Hotel Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Anita, T.L., Bina Nusantara University, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Hotel Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Triana, I., BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Consumer perception is one variable the company needs to understand what kind of facilities that will attract consumers to come and stay at the Capsule Hotel. The Capsule Hotel itself is the latest hotel type, which is adapted from the type of traditional lodging in Japan, and now become a simple-trend hotel with the various facilities offered. Technology-based facilities are one of the superior requirements to win positive perceptions of consumers. The purpose of this article is to analyze how consumer perceptions can affect technology-based facilities. A case study was conducted at Bobobox Capsule Hotel. Indicators of consumer perception, namely: advertising, reviews, public relations, social media, and personal experience, are proposed to determine their effect on technology-based facilities indicators, which are; sleeping facilities, technologies amenities, technology in-room access, and technology sophistication. The data analysis technique used is multiple linear regression. The results showed that consumer perception with advertising, reviews, public relations, social media, and personal experiences variables significantly affected the technology-based facilities at Bobobox Capsule Hotel. © 2020 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Capsule hotel; Consumer perception; Technology-based facility
Index Keywords: Information management; Linear regression; Marketing; Public relations; Social networking (online); Consumer perception; Data analysis techniques; Jakarta; Multiple linear regressions; Personal experience; Social media; Technology-based; Hotels

Authors: Subakti A.G., Pratomo A., Triana I., Khrisnanto I.
Title: Site attraction as a representation of heritage tourism: Case study of Gunung Padang Site, Cianjur, West - Java
Source title: IOP Conference Series: Earth and Environmental Science
Affiliations: Hotel Management Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Universitas Bina Nusantara, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Management Department, BINUS Business School, Undergraduate Program, Universitas Bina Nusantara, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Subakti, A.G., Hotel Management Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Universitas Bina Nusantara, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Pratomo, A., Hotel Management Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Universitas Bina Nusantara, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Triana, I., Management Department, BINUS Business School, Undergraduate Program, Universitas Bina Nusantara, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Khrisnanto, I., Hotel Management Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Universitas Bina Nusantara, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Heritage Tourism is used for experiencing the heritage of city, region, state or country. This travel enables the tourist to learn about local customs, traditions, history and culture. One of the tourist attractions in Cianjur, where an ancient historical megalithic site named Situs Gunung Padang could be found. Situs Gunung Padang which consists of five terraces and five levels, completely built stones. This site is the largest megalithic site in Southeast Asia. There is an enormous tourism potential owned by this site because it expresses and preserving ancient Sundanese cultural in the megalithic era. But the potential of this site seems haven't made as a tourist attraction compared with Borobudur or Prambanan Temple. The purpose of this research is to analyze the existence of Gunung Padang site as a heritage tourism with SWOT approach to discover what factors need to be repaired. The result of this research is showing that Gunung Padang site has a huge potential if the regional governments and the locals can contribute to preserve and making this site as a tourist attraction. © Published under licence by IOP Publishing Ltd.
Index Keywords: Five levels; Heritage tourisms; Regional government; Southeast Asia; Tourist attractions; West javas; History

Authors: Subakti A.G., Komsary K.C., Khrisnamurti N.
Title: Experiential marketing implication on museum: A case study on house of sampoerna museum
Source title: Heritage, Culture and Society: Research agenda and best practices in the hospitality and tourism industry - Proceedings of the 3rd International Hospitality and Tourism Conference, IHTC 2016 and 2nd International Seminar on Tourism, ISOT 2016
Affiliations: Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Jakarta State University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Subakti, A.G., Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Komsary, K.C., Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Khrisnamurti, N., Jakarta State University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: Tourism in many aspects is involving many experiential activities. Museum is one of tourist attractions that arise visitors’ emotional experience. The visitor experience is important in terms of developing and managing museum to maintain visitors’ visit. This study tries to analyze visitors’ different types of experience and expectations when they visit museum through perceived value. The data is collected and analyzed using Schmitt’s experiential marketing approach and a questionnaire of visitor experience and expectations. Some related discussions were proposed at the end of this paper. © 2016 Taylor & Francis Group, London.
Index Keywords: Commerce; Marketing; Emotional experiences; Interpretation; Perceived value; Tourist attractions; Visitor experiences; Museums
